						Week-2 Doubts

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

						DOUBT-1

Session on array_interview_questions - Timestamp 1:23

8. Find continuous subarray with a given sum (given non-negative numbers)
return the starting and ending index of the subarray
return 1st subarray in case of multiple

Code:

L = [1,22,13,7,9,11,10]
S = 16

d = {}
curr_sum = 0

for i in range(len(L)):
  curr_sum = curr_sum + L[i]

  if (curr_sum - S) in d:
    print(d[curr_sum - S]+1,i)
    break

  d[curr_sum] = i

How to approach the second method (above code) and its logic. Also explain why the membership op takes O(1) for set and dictionary part.

						DOUBT-5

Week-2 - task 5: Set ques 5

lst1 = {15, 10, 56, 23, 78, 5, 4, 9}
lst2 = {9, 4, 5, 36, 47, 26, 10, 45, 87}

[i for i in lst1 if i in lst2]

Output: [4, 5, 9, 10]

my ques is: final is a list so why duplicate items are not printed as list allows.
